intro: Cullumia floccosa, commonly known as the fluffhead larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It has hairy, glandular leaves and produces small, fluffy seed heads that aid in wind dispersal. Cullumia floccosa is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
